post.summary: Create or update an activity with a member
post.description:
Create or update an activity with a member
Activity existence is checked by sourceId and tenantId
Member existence is checked by platform and username
Create or update an activity. Existence is checked by sourceId and tenantId

delete.description: Delete a activity given an ID

get.description: Find a single activity by ID

put.description: Update an activity given an ID.

post.description: Query activities. It accepts filters, sorting options and pagination.
Create a new automation for the tenant.

get.description: Get all existing automation data for tenant.

parameters.name: filter[trigger]
parameters.description: Filter by trigger type of automation

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Skip the first n results. Default 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of results. Default 50.

delete.description: Destroys an existing automation in the tenant.

parameters.name: automationId
parameters.description: Automation ID that you want to update

get.description: Get an existing automation data in the tenant.

parameters.name: automationId
parameters.description: Automation ID that you want to find

put.description: Updates an existing automation in the tenant.

parameters.name: automationId
parameters.description: Automation ID that you want to update

get.description: Get all automation execution history for tenant and automation

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: How many elements from the beginning would you like to skip

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: How many elements would you like to fetch

get.description: Get a list of conversations with filtering, sorting and offsetting.

parameters.name: filter[title]
parameters.description: Filter by the title of the conversation.

parameters.name: filter[slug]
parameters.description: Filter by the slug of the conversation.

parameters.name: filter[published]
parameters.description: Filter by whether it is published or not.

parameters.name: filter[platform]
parameters.description: Filter by the platform of the conversation.

parameters.name: filter[channel]
parameters.description: Filter by the channel of the conversation.

parameters.name: filter[activitiesCountRange]
parameters.description: activitiesCount lower bound. If you want a range, send this parameter twice with [min] and [max]. If you send it once it will be interpreted as a lower bound.

parameters.name: filter[createdAtRange]
parameters.description: Created at lower bound. If you want a range, send this parameter twice with [min] and [max]. If you send it once it will be interpreted as a lower bound.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Skip the first n results. Default 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of results. Default 50.

put.description: Update a conversation given an ID.

get.description: List active members. It accepts filters, sorting options and pagination.

parameters.name: filter[platforms]
parameters.description: Filter by activity platforms (comma separated list without spaces)

parameters.name: filter[isTeamMember]
parameters.description: If true we will return just team members, if false we will return just non-team members, if undefined we will return both.

parameters.name: filter[isBot]
parameters.description: If true we will return just members who are bots, if false we will return just non-bot members, if undefined we will return both.

parameters.name: filter[isOrganization]
parameters.description: If true we will return just members who are organizations (such as linkedin organizations that post), if false we will return just non-organization members, if undefined we will return both.

parameters.name: filter[activityIsContribution]
parameters.description: Filter by activities that are contributions

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: How to sort results. Available values: activityCount_DESC, activityCount_ASC, activeDaysCount_DESC, activeDaysCount_ASC (default activityCount_DESC)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Skip the first n results. Default 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of results. Default 20.

post.description: Create or update a member. Existence is checked by platform and username.

delete.description: Delete a member given an ID

get.description: Find a single member by ID.

post.description: Export members. It accepts filters, sorting options and pagination.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the activity type

get.description: Get a list of members' attribute settings

parameters.name: filter[label]
parameters.description: Filter by label of member attribute settings

parameters.name: filter[name]
parameters.description: Filter by name of member attribute settings

parameters.name: filter[type]
parameters.description: Filter by type of member attribute settings

parameters.name: filter[createdAtRange]
parameters.description: CreatedAt lower bound. If you want a range, send this parameter twice with [min] and [max]. If you send it once it will be interpreted as a lower bound.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Skip the first n results. Default 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of results. Default 50.

get.description: Find a single members' attribute setting by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the member attribute's settings

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the member attribute settings

parameters.name: filter[name]
parameters.description: Filter by the name of the tag.

parameters.name: filter[createdAtRange]
parameters.description: Created at lower bound. If you want a range, send this parameter twice with [min] and [max]. If you send it once it will be interpreted as a lower bound.

parameters.description: Skip the first n results. Default 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of results. Default 50.

post.description: Query tasks. It accepts filters, sorting options and pagination.

ActivityUpsertInput.description: An activity performed by a member of your community. The member is sent as an ID.

memberId.description: The ID of the member that performed the activity

ActivityUpsertWithMemberInput.description: An activity performed by a member of your community. The member is sent as a whole object.

ActivityNoId.description: An activity performed by a member of your community.

timestamp.description: Date and time when the activity took place

platform.description: Platform on which the activity took place

sentiment.description:
Default sentiment score.
Computed by mapping (positive - negative) from 0 to 100

mixed.description: Mixed sentiment score. Mixed contains both positive and negative sentiments

sourceId.description: The id of the activity in the platform (e.g. the id of the message in Discord)

sourceParentId.description: The id of the parent activity in the platform (e.g. the id of the parent message in Discord)

parentId.description: Id of the parent activity, if the activity has a parent

isContribution.description: Whether the activity was a contribution

updatedAt.description: Date the activity was last updated

ActivityQuery.description: All the parameters you can use to query activitys.

filter.description: Filter. Please refer to filter docs.

limit.description: Limit the number of records returned. Default is 10.

offset.description: Offset the number of records returned. Default is 0.

id.description: The unique identifier for an activity.

ActivityResponse.description: An activity performed by a member.

AutomationCreateInput.description: Data to create a new automation.

AutomationUpdateInput.description: Data to update an existing automation.

AutomationExecutionState.description: What was the state of the automation execution

WebhookAutomationSettings.description: Settings used by automation with type webhook

url.description: URL to POST webhook data to

NewActivityAutomationSettings.description: Settings used by automation that is triggered by new activities

types.description: If activity type matches any of these we should trigger this automation

platforms.description: If activity came from any of these platforms we should trigger this automation

keywords.description: If activity content contains any of these keywords we should trigger this automation

teamMemberActivities.description: If activity came from any of our team members - should we trigger automation or not?

AutomationSettings.description: Settings based on automation type and trigger - you need to provide union object of both automation type based settings and trigger based settings

lastExecutionState.description: State of the last automation execution

lastExecutionError.description: Error information if last automation execution failed

rows.description: Array of automations that were fetched

count.description: How many total automations there are

offset.description: What offset was used when preparing this response

limit.description: What limit was used when preparing this response

error.description: If execution was not successful this object will contain error information

eventId.description: Unique ID of the event that triggered this automation execution.

payload.description: Payload that was sent when this execution was processed

count.description: How many items are there in total

offset.description: What offset was used when preparing this response

limit.description: What limit was used when preparing this response

ConversationNoId.description: A conversation is a group of activities. Some attributes, like slug, are mostly used in public pages.

published.description: Whether the conversation is publicaly visible from open pages.

memberCount.description: Number of participating members in the conversation.

lastActive.description: Last activity time in the conversation

updatedAt.description: Date the conversation was last updated

activities.description: List of IDs of the activities in the conversation

platform.description: Platform for which to check member existence.

organizations.description: Organizations associated with the member. Each element in the array is the name of the organization, or an organization object. If the organization does not exist, it will be created.
Organizations associated with the member. Each element in the array is the name of the organization, or an organization object. If the organization does not exist, it will be created.

tags.description: Tags associated with the member. Each element in the array is the ID of the tag.

tasks.description: Tasks associated with the member. Each element in the array is the ID of the task.

notes.description: Notes associated with the member. Each element in the array is the ID of the note.

activities.description: Activities associated with the member. Each element in the array is the ID of the activity.

username.description:
Usernames of the member in each platform. Exactly one for each platform in which the member is active.
Example: ```{ github: 'iamgilfoyle', discord: 'gilfoyle '}```

displayName.description: UI friendly name of the member

score.description: Engagement score of the member. From 0 to 10. Set -1 for not yet calculated.

reach.description:
Reach of the member in each platform. At most one for each platform in which the member is active.
Example: ```{ github: 10, twitter: 250, total: 260 }```

total.description: Sum of all the platform reaches.

attributes.description:
Attributes associated to the member. Each attribute must be an object with it's value for each platform, and a default.
For example: ```{"location": {"github": "San Francisco", "twitter": "California", "default": "San Francisco"}}```

updatedAt.description: Date the member was last updated

MemberAttribute.description:
A key for each platform.
- ```default``` is the value that will be displayed by default in the app
- ```custom``` is the value that will be displayed if the user has set a custom value for the attribute

default.description: Default value for the attribute. This is set automatically according to crowd.dev rules.

custom.description: Custom value for the attribute. This is optionally set by the user. It will always be picked as the default when sent.

MemberQuery.description: All the parameters you can use to query members.

filter.description: Filter. Please refer to filter docs.

limit.description: Limit the number of records returned. Default is 10.

offset.description: Offset the number of records returned. Default is 0.

id.description: The unique identifier for a member of your community.

activityCount.description: Number of activities performed by the member.

lastActivity.description: Timestamp, type and platform of the last activity performed by the member.

timestamp.description: Date and time of the last activity

averageSentiment.description: Average sentiment of the member. From 0 to 100.

identities.description: List of platforms the member has identities in.

activeOn.description: List of platforms the member is active on.

members.description: Members associated with the note. Each element in the array is the ID of the member.

updatedAt.description: Date the note was last updated.

NoteQuery.description: All the parameters you can use to query notes.

filter.description: Filter. Please refer to filter docs.

limit.description: Limit the number of records returned. Default is 10.

offset.description: Offset the number of records returned. Default is 0.

members.description: Members associated with the organization. Each element in the array is the ID of the member.

description.description: A short description of the organization.

logo.description: A URL for logo of the organization.

emails.description: The emails for contacting the organization.

phoneNumbers.description: The phone numbers for contacting for the organization.

parentUrl.description: The URL of the parent organization if it has one (for example if it has been acquired).

handle.description: The Twitter handle for the organization.

id.description: The Twitter ID for the organization.

bio.description: The Twitter bio for the organization.

followers.description: The number of followers on Twitter.

location.description: The Twitter location for the organization.

site.description: The website linked to the organization's Twitter profile.

avatar.description: The URL for the organization's Twitter avatar.

employees.description: The number of employees of the organization.

revenueRange.description: The estimated revenue range of the organization.

min.description: The minimum estimated revenue of the organization.

max.description: The maximum estimated revenue of the organization.

handle.description: The LinkedIn handle for the organization.
The Crunchbase handle for the organization.

activeOn.description: List of platforms the organization members are active on.

identities.description: List of platforms the organization members have identities in.

updatedAt.description: Date the organization was last updated.

OrganizationQuery.description: All the parameters you can use to query organizations.

filter.description: Filter. Please refer to filter docs.

limit.description: Limit the number of records returned. Default is 10.

offset.description: Offset the number of records returned. Default is 0.

activeOn.description: The platforms where the organization is active.

identities.description: The list of identities of the members in the organization.

lastActive.description: The last time the organization was active.

joinedAt.description: The date the first member from the organization joined the community.

TagNoId.description: A tag associated with a member.

updatedAt.description: Date the tag was last updated

id.description: The unique identifier for a tag.

members.description: Members associated with the task. Each element in the array is the ID of the member.

activities.description: Activities associated with the task. Each element in the array is the ID of the activity.

assignees.description: Users assigned with the task. Each element in the array is the ID of the user.

payload.description: Payload to send to the batch operation

filter.description: Filter to select the task entities. Please refer to filter docs.

update.description: key value object with desired updated fields.

updatedAt.description: Date the task was last updated.

TaskQuery.description: All the parameters you can use to query tasks.

filter.description: Filter. Please refer to filter docs.

limit.description: Limit the number of records returned. Default is 10.

offset.description: Offset the number of records returned. Default is 0.

assignedTo.description: The workspace member assigned to the task.

type.description: Human-friendly type of the activity. Default and short displays will set to this and key will be generated using this value.
Human-friendly type of the activity. Default and short displays will set to this and key will be generated using this value.

default.description: Default display of an activity type. Used in the activity module in the app.

short.description: Short display version of an activity type. Used in the member list -> last activity.

channel.description: Channel display of an activity type. Used in Dashboard -> trending conversations.

custom.description: Custom activity types defined by the user.

default.description: Default activity types used by the integrations.

label.description: Human-friendly name of the attribute. Label is unique in workspaces.

show.description: Whether to show the member attribute in the web app or not.

MemberAttributeSettingsNoId.description: A member attribute that can be created dynamically.

label.description: Human-friendly name of the attribute. Label is unique in workspaces.

name.description: Camel-case code friendly name of the attribute. If ommited, name will be generated from the label. Name is unique in workspaces.

canDelete.description: If set to false, member attribute can not be deleted in future requests.

show.description: Whether to show the member attribute in the web app or not.

createdAt.description: Date the member attribute was created.

updatedAt.description: Date the member attribute was last updated.

MemberAttributeSettingsList.description: List and count member attribute settings.

pull_request-opened.default: opened a new pull request in {channel}

pull_request-comment.default: commented on a pull request in {channel}

message.default: sent a message in #{channel}

thread_message.default: replied to a message in thread #{channel} -> {attributes.parentChannel}

reaction.default: reacted with on a post {attributes.postBody}
